alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 6:34PM EDT until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Bulloch, Chatham, Effingham, Evans, Liberty and Tattnall. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Reidsville, Springfield, Claxton, Pembroke, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, Lanier, Rincon, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Hardeeville, Bloomingdale, Guyton, Hagan, Collins, Daisy, Bellville, Manassas and Bay.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
